0: LARGO, Fla. — The mother of the 2-year-old Largo boy that had been the subject of an Ambert Alert for several days has been arrested and charged in the boy's death. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Body of missing 2-year-old boy found in wooded area near Lake Avenue, McMullen Road NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Charisse Stinson, 21, charged with 1st degree murder NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Investigation ongoing NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Body of missing Largo boy, 2, found NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Charisse Stinson, 21, faces aggravated child abuse and first degree murder charges in connection with Jordan Belliveau's death. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR A judge Wednesday afternoon set no bond for the murder charge and $500 on the child abuse charge. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR #JordanBelliveau grandmother and great-aunts speak out after #CharisseStinson 1st appearance in court. Judge set no bond on murder charge; $500 on child abuse. @BN9 pic.twitter.com/m9kricVKIb — DaveJordanBN9 (@DaveJordanBN9) September 5, 2018 NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Jordan's grandmother, Jessica Belliveau, said she was pleased with the judge's ruling. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "She doesn't deserve a bond," Belliveau said. "Why should she be given a chance? My grandson wasn't given a chance." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Failure of the system NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Meanwhile, the child's foster parents, who had custody of Jordan from January 2017 to May 2018, said the boy was "failed by the system." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "He flourished and grew in a community that loved him deeply," Sam Warren said. "Jordan was failed by the system." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR During a news conference Wednesday morning, Largo Police Lt. Randall Chaney confirmed the charges and added multiple details of the case. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Chaney said Stinson acted alone in the boy's death and there was no one else involved. He added that police are searching for a person that may have come in contact with Stinson last Saturday evening at Largo Central Park. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Here’s a photo of the Warren’s with Jordan. This was his first birthday. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “We are devastated by his loss. But for a court order, he would still be safe in our home,” Sam said. “Promises that were made to us about how he would be protected after his return were broken.” @BN9 pic.twitter.com/Xmi91zLZYi — Jorja Roman (@JorjaRoman) September 5, 2018 NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Police added Stinson showed little emotion during her confession. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Largo Police converged on a wooded area near Lake Avenue and McMullen Booth Road late Tuesday afternoon. Shortly after, they made a short announcement confirming they had found the boy's body. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR In an exclusive interview with Spectrum News conducted earlier Tuesday, Stinson, who did not want to be on camera, maintained her story that Jordan was abducted. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "There's a lot of concern because my son, we have DCF involved, but it is not towards me being a horrible parent or anything like that," Stinson said. "And I just really want people to know that I am a good mom. I am a good mother. I am a damn good mom." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Jordan was last seen in the area of Lake Avenue and East Bay Drive in Largo on Saturday. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Police: story was all a lie NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR According to police, Stinson told them she and her son were walking from their home Saturday evening when she accepted a ride from a stranger. She claimed that the man, named Antwan, attacked her and beat her unconscious. When she woke up in Largo Central Park, Jordan was gone, she said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The story though was all a lie according to police, who added that Stinson's wounds were self-inflicted. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR According to a police report, Stinson became upset with Jordan and struck the child across the face with the back of her hand. Police say the back of his head then hit a wall causing severe injuries. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR He suffered seizures throughout the night, until he eventually died, authorities said. Police said Stinson then took the body to the wooded area and left the boy there. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Authorities said Jordan spent the majority of his life in foster care. He was taken away from Stinson at 3 months old, but she regained custody in May. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Police reports dating back to July of this year show a history of domestic violence between Jordan 's parents. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Also, Stinson is pregnant and due to give birth in December. It is not known who the father is. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR An investigation is ongoing but police did say that it remains unknown if this weekend's discovery of bloody items at Stinson's apartment is related to the child's death.
